result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:11 am 
INCLUDES 15CF942 AND 15CF943. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF942: Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Operate without valid license (3rd+ within 3yrs))>>D&RI. 
In 15CF943: Ct. 1 (Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 15CF942: Ct. 1 (Vehicle Operator Flee-Elude Officer/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 
                               : Ct. 4 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation on Ct. 1 and 2 years probation on Ct. 4 - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; no contact with A.C; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; pay restitution of $155.78 to L.S. at a rate of at least $10 per month until paid in full; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 73 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 10:24 am

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:02 am 
INCLUDES 15CF942 AND 15CF943. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Morgan.
State notes parties have reached agreement in this matter and notes time is needed to comply with victim rights. 
COURT notes plea hearing should be set prior to speedy trial date and that the speedy trial date will remain on until plea is done. 
Parties request plea hearing be set for later today. 
COURT sets plea hearing for 12/17/2015 at 4pm. 
Adj: 11:03 am

Clerk Marisa.

Argument.

Appearances are the same. 
Atty Morgan withdraws bond motion at this time. 
COURT notes it will holds ruling on motion in abeyance rather than have bond motion withdrawn.

Clerk Becky.

of No Contact signed by L.A. dated 10/19/15

Includes 15CF942 and 15CF943. No contact with victim(s):  L.S., A.C. and L.A.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall not consume alcohol.   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety.
